details:
verb
- take off weight
= synonyms: thin
- lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
= synonyms: thin
- narrow or limit
= example: narrow or limit
= synonyms: tighten
- cook until very little liquid is left
= example: cook until very little liquid is left
= synonyms: concentrate
- be cooked until very little liquid is left
= example: be cooked until very little liquid is left
= synonyms: concentrate
- be the essential element
= synonyms: come down, boil down
- to remove oxygen from a compound, or cause to react with hydrogen or form a hydride, or to undergo an increase in the number of electrons
= synonyms: deoxidise, deoxidize
- make smaller
= example: make smaller
= synonyms: decrease
- reduce in size
= example: reduce in size
= synonyms: shrink
- make less complex
= example: make less complex
- reduce in scope while retaining essential elements
= synonyms: contract
- cut down on
= synonyms: cut
- destress and thus weaken a sound when pronouncing it
- reposition (a broken bone after surgery) back to its normal site
- undergo meiosis
= example: undergo meiosis
- lower in grade or rank or force somebody into an undignified situation
= example: lower in grade or rank or force somebody into an undignified situation
- simplify the form of a mathematical equation of expression by substituting one term for another
- lessen and make more modest
= example: lessen and make more modest
- bring to humbler or weaker state or condition
= example: bring to humbler or weaker state or condition
- put down by force or intimidation
= synonyms: keep down, subdue, repress, quash, subjugate
